remarks: A mapping (first hypothesis) that is one-to-one (second hypothesis) implies its domain is dominated by its codomain.  (Contributed by NM, 24-Jul-2004.)
statement:
dom2d.1 $e |- ( ph -> ( x e. A -> C e. B ) ) $.
dom2d.2 $e |- ( ph -> ( ( x e. A /\ y e. A ) -> ( C = D <-> x = y ) ) ) $.
dom2lem $p |- ( ph -> ( x e. A |-> C ) : A -1-1-> B ) $.
$d A x y $.
$d B x y $.
$d C y $.
$d D x $.
$d ph x y $.
